page.title: 14STABLE BLOCK OF HATLEY HALL
page.content: A Victorian stable block, once part of Hatley Hall,has been put to several unusual uses from the original of sheltering horses. Until recently it was used by 120 sows who produced around 3000 piglets a year for the bacon industry but, since the clay soil makes the disposal of effluent difficult and, the pasturing of pigs in open fields, messy,the stable blocks have been converted into units for leasing to local craftsmen. Small industries have been set up there including a silversmith and jeweller, a pipeline cleaning firm,a research firm,a furniture maker and a computer firm.
